intro: Guettarda coriacea, commonly known as the rough-leaved guettarda, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important species. The plant is characterized by its woody stem and leathery, elliptical leaves that are often covered in a fine, rough texture. It produces small, fragrant white flowers that are typically clustered in terminal panicles. Guettarda coriacea is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in tropical and subtropical climates.
